verses.verse: ((Ps. 30:5; Is. 57:16); Jer. 3:5; (Mic. 7:18)) He will not always strive with us, Nor will He keep His anger forever.
((Ezra 9:13; Lam. 3:22)) He has not dealt with us according to our sins, Nor punished us according to our iniquities.
For as the heavens are high above the earth, So great is His mercy toward those who fear Him;
As far as the east is from the west, So far has He ((2 Sam. 12:13; Is. 38:17; 43:25; Zech. 3:9; Heb. 9:26)) removed our transgressions from us.
(Mal. 3:17) As a father pities his children, So the LORD pities those who fear Him.
For He knows our frame; He remembers that we are dust.
As for man, (Is. 40:6-8; James 1:10, 11; 1 Pet. 1:24) his days are like grass; As a flower of the field, so he flourishes.
((Is. 40:7)) For the wind passes over it, and it is gone, And (Job 7:10) its place remembers it no more.
But the mercy of the LORD is from everlasting to everlasting On those who fear Him, And His righteousness to children’s children,
((Deut. 7:9); Ps. 25:10) To such as keep His covenant, And to those who remember His commandments to do them.
The LORD has established His throne in heaven, And ((Ps. 47:2; Dan. 4:17, 25)) His kingdom rules over all.
(Ps. 148:2) Bless the LORD, you His angels, Who excel in strength, who ((Matt. 6:10)) do His word, Heeding the voice of His word.
Bless the LORD, all you His hosts, ((Heb. 1:14)) You ministers of His, who do His pleasure.
Bless the LORD, all His works, In all places of His dominion. Bless the LORD, O my soul!
(Praise to the Sovereign LORD for His Creation and Providence) Bless (Ps. 103:1) the LORD, O my soul! O LORD my God, You are very great: You are clothed with honor and majesty,
Who cover Yourself with light as with a garment, Who stretch out the heavens like a curtain.
((Amos 9:6)) He lays the beams of His upper chambers in the waters, Who makes the clouds His chariot, Who walks on the wings of the wind,
Who makes His angels spirits, His ministers a flame of fire.
You who laid the foundations of the earth, So that it should not be moved forever,
You (Gen. 1:6) covered it with the deep as with a garment; The waters stood above the mountains.
At Your rebuke they fled; At the voice of Your thunder they hastened away.
They went up over the mountains; They went down into the valleys, To the place which You founded for them.
You have (Job 26:10; Ps. 33:7; (Jer. 5:22)) set a boundary that they may not pass over, (Gen. 9:11-15) That they may not return to cover the earth.
He sends the springs into the valleys; They flow among the hills.
They give drink to every beast of the field; The wild donkeys quench their thirst.
By them the birds of the heavens have their home; They sing among the branches.
(Ps. 147:8) He waters the hills from His upper chambers; The earth is satisfied with (Jer. 10:13) the fruit of Your works.
(Gen. 1:29) He causes the grass to grow for the cattle, And vegetation for the service of man, That he may bring forth (Job 28:5) food from the earth,
And (Judg. 9:13; Ps. 23:5; Prov. 31:6; Eccl. 10:19) wine that makes glad the heart of man, Oil to make his face shine, And bread which strengthens man’s heart.
The trees of the LORD are full of sap, The cedars of Lebanon which He planted,
Where the birds make their nests; The stork has her home in the fir trees.
The high hills are for the wild goats; The cliffs are a refuge for the (Lev. 11:5) rock badgers.
(Gen. 1:14) He appointed the moon for seasons; The (Job 38:12; Ps. 19:6) sun knows its going down.
((Ps. 74:16; Is. 45:7)) You make darkness, and it is night, In which all the beasts of the forest creep about.
(Job 38:39) The young lions roar after their prey, And seek their food from God.
